intro: Lepidagathis brevispica, commonly known as the short-bracted lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or understoreys. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
